com.barryholroyd.productlisttechdemo.product_info

Class ProductListOnScrollListener

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.OnScrollListener
      • com.barryholroyd.productlisttechdemo.product_info.ProductListOnScrollListener

  • public class ProductListOnScrollListener
extends android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.OnScrollListener
    Load additional data (more product information from the cloud) in advance of actually needing to display it.

    Overview:
    When the visible leading edge (the last row displayed at the bottom of the RecyclerView display) approaches the last row currently loaded into the backing array, we need to pre-fetch additional rows from the cloud and load them into the backing array so that scrolling pauses are minimized.

    Note: All row references are for the backing array.

    Definitions:

    firstVisibleRow
    first visible row
    totalVisibleRows
    total number of visible rows
    lastVisibleRow
    last visible row (firstVisibleRow + totalVisibleRows)
    TRIGGER_DISTANCE
    look-ahead distance -- triggers pre-loading from cloud
    totalLoadedRows
    total number of rows currently loaded from the cloud
    batchSize
    batch size to load from the could into the adapter (defined in GetProducts).

    Algorithm: When lastVisibleRow + triggerDistance > lastLoadedRow, load batchSize more rows from the cloud into the adapter.

    Author:
    Barry Holroyd

        private static final int TRIGGER_DISTANCE

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • totalLoadedRowsPrevious

        private int totalLoadedRowsPrevious
        Saved value of totalLoadedRows; used to determine when adapter array has been refreshed. It starts at 1 because a header row gets added manually to the adapter's set of rows.

      • loading

        private boolean loading
        True when the adapter is loading more data into the backing array from the cloud.

    • Method Detail

      • onScrolled

        public void onScrolled(android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView recyclerView,
                       int dx,
                       int dy)
        Standard onScrolled() callback for RecylerView.

        Called multiple times when a user is scrolling the RecyclerView. Since this will be called many times a second during the scrolling, we want to limit the amount of processing here as much as possible. We also want to minimize the time we have code here locked.

        Since we are interested in the visible rows, we include the manually added header row in the row count.

        Overrides:
        onScrolled in class android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.OnScrollListener
        Parameters:
        recyclerView - the RecyclerView being scrolled.
        dx - the horizontal distance scrolled in pixels.
        dy - the vertical distance scrolled in pixels.
